title: Reset admin password to Admin@123 and redeploy

requirements.text: Reset the default admin credentials so that the admin username remains `admin` and the admin password is set to `Admin@123`, ensuring that the admin username/password login flow accepts these credentials immediately after deployment.

quotes: I don't remember setting a password. Please reset the admin password to 'Admin@123' and redeploy so I can log in immediately.

acceptanceCriteria: Calling the backend admin login method with username `admin` and password `Admin@123` succeeds and returns a non-empty admin token.
Calling the backend admin login method with username `admin` and an incorrect password fails with an error message that includes the text "Invalid username or password".
This change is effective after redeployment without requiring any manual setup steps from the user.

requirements.text: Update the admin login UI copy to reflect the reset password in English (do not change the username text), so the login screen does not incorrectly state that the password was set during deployment.

quotes: Please reset the admin password to 'Admin@123' and redeploy so I can log in immediately.

acceptanceCriteria: On `/admin/login`, the helper text under "Default admin username: admin" indicates the current password is `Admin@123` (English text).
All existing admin login form validations and error messaging remain functional.

requirements.text: Update the frontend documentation to explicitly state the admin login URL and the current default admin credentials (username `admin`, password `Admin@123`) in English.

quotes: Please reset the admin password to 'Admin@123' and redeploy so I can log in immediately.

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/README.md` includes the admin login URL `/admin/login` and lists the default admin username as `admin` and password as `Admin@123` in English.
Documentation is consistent with the actual deployed behavior (credentials work as written).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in `backend/main.mo` (no additional backend services).
Only add `backend/migration.mo` if state migration is required by the implementation and follows the projectâ€™s conditional migration policy.
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or any other frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

nonGoals: Do not add a user-facing admin password reset workflow or email-based reset flow.
Do not change customer authentication (Internet Identity) behavior.
Do not introduce third-party authentication providers or external databases/services.
